text: Hi everyone, does someone know a tool or service that can tell me which companies are using a certain software?
Hi, is the image file format WebP not supported in HubSpot?
here are all the file formats supported by HubSpot <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/cos-general/what-file-types-can-i-upload-to-HubSpot> hope this is helpful.
I remember a Salesforce integration with Datanyze that showed technology. <https://www.datanyze.com/technology-tracking> | I use BuiltWith for web tecnologies <https://builtwith.com/>
Thanks, it's a shame that the file format WebP isn't supported. Do you know if HubSpot are planning to support it in the near future?
Hi Stephanie, thanks for the Links!
+1 for webp and webm support

<@UC2J7BPA7> actually it’s misleading to say they don’t support WebP, they actually do in the coolest way. See, you do not need to upload webp images, because they convert all of your images to webp automatically, and serve that version to users if their browsers support it. The way they are doing it the file name is shown as .jpg or .png but the file will actually be a webp image with that file name instead. They’re doing it all server side. It’s bloody magic
HubSpot converts all of your images to webp if it can be
If you need proof, use the latest version of google chrome, find one of your images. open it in a new tab, then right click and do save as. odds are it will want to save it as a webp image

Not sure what channel this is best in but -- Our company uses HubSpot as the CMS.  We are currently using an outdated template and I want to work on a custom template for them.  Is it possible to code the full site and then add in the Hubl required tags??

Additionally can you use React for your website and still use HubSpot CMS -- I know that HubSpot uses React.
:brain: =:brain:

Yes to both.

The react side of things though you will need to do your preprocessing before you put the code on HubSpot.(babel+webpack that kinda stuff)
You actually can sand box the site in HubSpot and use ftp/transmit to develop locally and see the results online.
What Jon Said.
BUT you can create a set of templates offline and then drop the tags in later as well.
I just tried it and the image is a .png
I think it works like the image resize function, If the png is smaller or same size as the webp it may not resize(because there’d be no significant gain)
find a big image
and try it with that
I had an annoying thing where any image i tried to download in chrome was webp but i think that was chrome converting it, it seems to have fixed it’s self now though

Though most of the time react is not the most suitable tool for a whole website on HubSpot, HubSpot is built as a marketing website platform, I would think if you were going to have say a software as a service website, HubSPot would be the front end and you’d have something else for when people sign in - and that app would be the full react side of things.

I will say though VueJS also plays nicely on HubSpot, and I love it to bits

<@U38EZFVFE> Thanks -- I was hoping to create the new site in React and add in the Hubl tags as needed (primary goal)

I have downloaded the Hubl Server and poked around with the VAST templates that come with it but there is some level of disconnect for me.  I feel I am missing something with it.
Yeah.. you arent going crazy.
Would HubSpot do the convert with a background image called using css?
yep
I see that happening on my sites
all images served from HubSpot are  auto converted if it makes sense to
and it uses server side detection, so the file name does not change -giving an added benefit of making it so if you send the link to someone, the image will be progressively enhanced
Is there a way to setup follow up emails on the Forms tool in HubSpot?
Instead of on the page itself?
think you can do it through workflows. but idk that you can globally set it for the form
ok got ya
so in that case I would have to have a workflow for every resource on my site right <@U7SL518D6>
<https://www.responsiveinboundmarketing.com/available-resources> - that is the page that I'm working on
possibly
ok
that makes sense
thank you <@U7SL518D6>
appreciate you

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Content-Design-Questions/Can-you-setup-local-development-on-HubSpot-CMS-SASS-LESS/td-p/199430>

Might be helpful?
if my site has ssl on the naked domain, it should be ok to redirect to HubSpots <https://www> right?

stumbled on this the other day, and now I'm full of questions.  Anyone have experience with this?  Any major downfalls? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/articles/kcs_article/collected-forms/use-non-HubSpot-forms>
Assuming your DNS provider supports the http > https redirect, then yes.
net sol
it was redirecting to https yesteday, but since we migrated to HubSpot, sad faces
We used this with wordpress site contact forms through HubSpots plugins
It worked, there wasnt really any pitfalls we noticed but we werent trying to get complicated like triggering workflows off of those forms or anything
Mostly wondering if it would be useful for multi-step forms, or anything else that is challenging with HubSpot forms

haven’t tried that, but that’s worth investigating, but I think you’d maybe have to submit the form at each step or have a hidden form that was actually what was getting updated or something for it to work.
fyi, network solutions said that even though we have a wildcard ssl on netsol, it cannot redirect to a ssl on a dif server
so because www is hosted with HubSpot, it will fail

Hm. That doesn't seem right to me (unless I'm misunderstanding) because we recommend EasyRedir for naked http > https redirects pretty often, then www is hosted on HubSpot. That said, I'm not a technical expert here so adding <@U6W3H6YN8> who can likely help out more.

The redirect and cert from your apex domain will need to be handled on an external (non-HubSpot) server, but if your apex domain hosting does support this, there is no reason you can not send visitors to the https version of any website from the secure apex.

What is going wrong right now? Is the issue occurring at requests to the apex? Or on the HubSpot hosted subdomains?
apex

<https://www.google.com/search?source=hp&ei=m1fkW5jOHeq1ggfRxqHQAg&q=hr+acuity&btnK=Google+Search&oq=hr+ac&gs_l=psy-ab.3.1.0l10.958.2331..4117...0.0..0.74.367.6......0....1..gws-wiz.....0..0i10.qqxwvh2thFc>
the non ad link on that search page
<https://hracuity.com>
network solutions said that even  though we have a wildcard ssl cert with them, they cannot pass it to a subdomain if it is hosted on a different server
also, thanks for help :slightly_smiling_face:

Yea <https://hracuity.com/> does not seem to be resolving at all for me right now (`ERR_CONNECTION_TIMED_OUT`).

They are right that the cert they provisioned can not be used on the HubSpot hosted subdomains, but we handle the HubSpot hosted cert (<https://www.hracuity.com> has a cert).

There is no reason you can not redirect any request anywhere (say, to <https://www.facebook.com>).

Something seems to be wrong with the server handling requests to the secure apex
hmmm
i am at a loss on how to move forward
call back and hope for a different customer service agent?
i assume <@U6W3H6YN8> is calling net sol on my behalf presently :takemymoney:
HAHAHA
Yea I would give them a call back, at a base level, HubSpot aside, it does not seem like they are handling requests to the secure apex at all
k.  thanks
to the batphone
apologies for persistent questions, <@U6W3H6YN8>, but would this cause the timeout?
from the HubSpot knowledge base for site migration
<@U7SL518D6> speaks the truth
I believe that is the generic NS solutions forwarding IP

<@U22PJPGK0> I don’t know who over there implemented the webp feature but from the bottom of my heart, thank you, it’s freakin’ awesome.

I love all the optimizations you guys do that we don’t even have to think about.

When I talk to other developers, that come from say wordpress, they talk about “man I have 18 plugins for all these optimizations, I have this build process with like 16 node modules” “I’ve got 99 features but plugins and build processes? not one.”
Here’s a secret: Cloudflare does that optimization for us (we do the resizing though) <https://support.cloudflare.com/hc/en-us/articles/360000607372-Using-Polish-to-compress-images-on-Cloudflare>

ahh, yea cloudflare is also one of those companies where you’re like ” I don’t know how you’re doing what you’re doing, but I will happily accept it as magic, and pay for it”

still you guys do a fair amount of optimization stuff like now you guys do the preconnects and whatnot. you minify and combine files.
that IP doesnt have a valid ssl.  fun stuff!

Kill DM1!
Long live DM2
Trust us, no one wants DM1 retired more than we do. But there’s still some things we need to work out to make the transition less painful.
i think the upgrade button should follow the cursor
just a thought
maybe have it increase in size and a flip animation on mousedown

I have been developing the site using React -- I am thinking I will use the REST API and then what ever I need with HUBL tags :slightly_smiling_face:  If you all can do a video about React dev and HubSpot CMS would be awesome... or resources for this.

lol wish I could find a video clip of it, but I was thinking like in the 90s PC game Star Warped - the quit button would litterally try to run away from the mouse, and make noises and squish and flip as you chased it with your mouse
aiight, when I get the chance I’ll move your upgrade button then, understood on why it is taking a while to do it, it’s a big change and could have negative effects if not done correctly
Taking a note about it - I believe our HubSpot (dot) com team uses React... I'll hunt around and see what I can do, however, not sure on a timeframe.
